content: Hey @Mahendra Paipuri welcome to the show!
Let me just move your question to its own topic :slight_smile:
I once upon a time did write all the stuff in gdcc/dataverse-kubernetes :wink:
Aside from me, there's @Johannes D and @Vera Clemens that I know of running Dataverse on a K8s cluster.
They have been working on a Helmchart here: https://github.com/nfdi4health/csh-deployment/tree/main/k8s/dataverse
I am using FluxCD with Kustomizations to deploy Dataverse, leveraging some of the nice functionality in Kustomize around mapping files to configmaps etc.
I'm sure that a Helm chart would be of interest to the community and we can probably use some of the experiences made so far.

For example, I always had this pipe dream about an operator, which can also take care about things like metadata blocks, and other stuff that would be good to put under a reconciliation loop and fed to the backend via API.
Should we talk about this tomorrow at our monthly meeting? @Mahendra Paipuri you're welcome to come! Please see https://ct.gdcc.io and #containers > meetings.

Thanks @Oliver Bertuch!! Cheers for the helm chart link, very useful!! I think we can start working from this chart to make it into a more generic one! And eventually we can add an operator as you proposed. I have pretty decent experience with Golang and operator framework!!
